skill.description: Monitors Claude's responses for struggle signals and suggests escalation to deep-thinking agents when complexity exceeds comfortable reasoning capacity.

security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based skill containing only documentation and guidance. No code execution, file access, network calls, or command execution capabilities. The skill provides instructional content about self-assessment and escalation patterns.

content.user_title: Detect struggle signals and escalate complex tasks
content.value_statement: AI assistants often struggle with complex problems but lack self-awareness to recognize when they need help. This skill provides a framework for detecting struggle signals and knowing when to escalate to specialized deep-thinking agents for better outcomes.
actual_capabilities: Detects struggle signals like hedging, deflection, and contradiction in responses
Identifies high-complexity scenarios requiring deep-thinking agents
Provides escalation checklist for self-assessment before responding
Guides proper escalation format when calling deep-think-partner agent
Maps struggle signals to recommended mitigation strategies
Tracks struggle detection patterns to improve self-awareness
limitations: Does not execute code or perform actual problem solving
Cannot automatically escalate without explicit agent invocation
Does not monitor real-time response generation
Depends on deep-think-partner agent being available in the system

use_cases.title: Build self-aware assistants
use_cases.description: Integrate metacognitive awareness into AI systems to improve response quality through proper escalation

use_cases.title: Route complex tasks
use_cases.description: Detect when problems exceed current reasoning capacity and invoke specialized thinking agents

use_cases.title: Improve AI collaboration
use_cases.description: Ensure AI assistants recognize their limits and seek help for architectural decisions

prompt_templates.title: Check readiness
prompt_templates.prompt: Use Metacognitive Guard to self-assess: Can I give a concrete recommendation? Do I have high confidence? Is this answerable without follow-up exchanges? Would structured analysis add value?

prompt_templates.title: Analyze complexity
prompt_templates.prompt: Apply Metacognitive Guard: Does this involve multiple valid approaches with competing constraints? Do trade-offs span performance, maintainability, and cost? Does the decision affect multiple components?

prompt_templates.title: Evaluate ambiguity
prompt_templates.prompt: Metacognitive Guard check: Have I explored all reasonable interpretations? Does the wrong choice have significant rework cost? Should I escalate to deep-think-partner?

prompt_templates.title: Escalate properly
prompt_templates.prompt: Use Metacognitive Guard escalation format: Include context (system/codebase), constraints (limits on solution space), success criteria, and the specific question requiring decision

output_examples.input: Should we use Redis or PostgreSQL for session storage in our web app?
output: Confidence Check: This involves multiple valid approaches with competing constraints
Key factors to analyze: existing PostgreSQL expertise, Redis learning curve, cost considerations
Escalation Recommended: Deep-think-partner can provide structured analysis with clear recommendation
Escalation Format: Include context (10k concurrent users, existing PostgreSQL), constraints (team skills, cost sensitivity), success criteria (clear recommendation with migration path)

best_practices: Use the self-assessment checklist proactively before responding to complex questions
Escalate early when multiple valid approaches exist or constraints are unclear
Include context, constraints, success criteria, and specific questions when invoking deep-think-partner
anti_patterns: Responding with 'it depends' instead of escalating for deeper analysis
Making recommendations without explicitly stating confidence level
Continuing to struggle through a complex problem without considering escalation

faq.question: What AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Compatible with Claude and Claude Code. Requires deep-think-partner agent for full escalation workflow.

faq.question: What are the complexity limits?
faq.answer: No hard limits. The skill helps identify when problems exceed comfortable reasoning capacity through pattern recognition.

faq.question: How do I integrate with other agents?
faq.answer: Use the Task tool with subagent_type: deep-think-partner. Include context, constraints, success criteria, and specific questions.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a prompt-based skill with no code execution, file access, or network calls. All analysis happens through Claude's reasoning.

faq.question: What if escalation fails?
faq.answer: Ensure deep-think-partner agent is available. The skill provides guidance but does not execute escalations automatically.

faq.question: How is this different from struggle detection hooks?
faq.answer: This skill provides proactive self-assessment guidance. Hooks are reactive triggers. Use both for comprehensive coverage.
